creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
text:
If there is a problem connecting to a database via JDBC (e.g. the wrong 
database name) then JMeter keeps trying the same request over and over, and 
does not seem to give up at all ...

Sample trace (showing JMeter classes only):
04/09/2003 12:48:53 PM ERROR - jmeter.protocol.jdbc:  java.sql.SQLException: 
Fatal db error: could not open db "dbnane" for user "USER" : E_US0010 Database 
does not exist: 'dbname'.
    (WED APR  9 12:48:50 2003)
...
	at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(DriverManager.java:512)
	at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(DriverManager.java:171)
	at org.apache.jmeter.protocol.jdbc.util.DBConnectionManager.setup
(DBConnectionManager.java:162)
	at org.apache.jmeter.protocol.jdbc.util.DBConnectionManager.getKey
(DBConnectionManager.java:134)
	at org.apache.jmeter.protocol.jdbc.sampler.JDBCSampler.getKey
(JDBCSampler.java:269)
	at org.apache.jmeter.protocol.jdbc.sampler.JDBCSampler.sample
(JDBCSampler.java:151)
	at org.apache.jmeter.threads.JMeterThread.run(JMeterThread.java:158)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

04/09/2003 12:48:56 PM ERROR - jmeter.protocol.jdbc: ConnectionObject: url = 
jdbc:.../dbname java.sql.SQLException: Fatal db error: could not open 
db "dbname" for user "USER" : E_US0010 Database does not exist: 'dbname'.
    (WED APR  9 12:48:52 2003)
...
	at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(DriverManager.java:512)
	at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(DriverManager.java:171)
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.jdbc.util.DBConnectionManager.newConnection
(DBConnectionManager.java:246)
	at org.apache.jmeter.protocol.jdbc.util.ConnectionObject.reset
(ConnectionObject.java:254)
	at org.apache.jmeter.protocol.jdbc.util.ConnectionObject.run
(ConnectionObject.java:226)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

====================================

Hope to look at this in more detail soon; maybe post a patch....
Yes, it's very persistent.  JMeter is not a quitter!
creator: mstover1@apache.org
mstover1@apache.org
text:
Should be fixed.  JMeter will throw exceptions from the connection manager and
the sample will fail each time.  But,the connection manager won't keep trying
forever.
